decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.
Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: 22280/01, 22280/20, 22280/10, 22280/11, Fire Safety Statement D12a, Biodiversity checklist, Energy Statement, Notional and Proposed Confirmation Sheet � received 2nd September 2024, 2349/01 A, 2349/02 A, 2349/03 A, 2349/04 A � received 28th October 2024.

Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - The development hereby permitted shall only be used for a purpose ancillary to the enjoyment of the house at the 'Site Address' described at the top of this decision letter and shall not be occupied as a separate dwelling nor used for business purposes and the means of access to the accommodation shall not be other than via the existing dwelling (i.e. access shall not be from Willow Cottages access road to the side of the existing dwelling).
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions and the character of the area.

Condition : 5 - No additional windows or openings shall be formed in the elevations of the development hereby permitted.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' privacy.

Condition : 6 - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until the measures and targets set out in the approved Energy Strategy have been implemented in full.

Reason: In order to ensure that the development makes the fullest contribution to minimising carbon dioxide emissions.

Condition : 7 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no fences, gates, walls or other means of enclosure shall be erected on any part of the site which shall have the effect of sub-dividing the plot and facilitating the use of the development as a full independent unit of accommodation with no link to the existing dwelling. 
Reason: In order to protect the appearance of the area, the living conditions of neighbours and that of occupiers of the development.
description: Conversion of the detached garage into a habitable accommodation ancillary to the residential use of the main house
